CatDescriptText: Mr. Murray Jefferson, messenger, of Homewood, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 26, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "In your opinion, what effect on the community do interracial churches have? Do you believe this type of membership should be encouraged?  Why?"  Answer reads: "It brings togetherness, therefore I think it's a good idea.  There is only one race and that is the human race.  I think it should be promoted."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Murray Jefferson, wearing trench coat with collar and pockets, dark hat with light colored band, and eyeglasses, standing on Liberty Avenue in front of entrance to Empire Building, Jenkins Arcade entrance in background, Downtown
